definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
sluggish
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The stagnant global economy will dent China's export growth for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 停滞不前的全球经济将削弱中国未来几年的出口增长。

sentences.english: Because commercial pattern is pendent , all jobs backwater not before.
sentences.chinese: 由于商业模式悬而未决，所有的工作都停滞不前。

sentences.english: And in Japan, a young man (Masi Oka, NBC's " Scrubs ") develops a way to stop time through sheer will power.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，一个年轻人集中精力竟可以使时间停滞不前。

sentences.english: During this era, new development of the Financial District had stagnated .
sentences.chinese: 在这个时代，新发展的金融区已停滞不前。

sentences.english: What can I say to you ones that will enable you to comprehend that time never stands still.
sentences.chinese: 我如何表述才能够令你们理解，时间永不会停滞不前。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 闭关锁国，停滞不前成了这个文明古国的代名词。

sentences.english: But isolation does not mean Chinese television is stagnating.
sentences.chinese: 但是，隔离并不意味着中国的电视业是停滞不前的。

sentences.english: Then there are times when we stagnate.
sentences.chinese: 然而有的时候，我们会停滞不前。

sentences.english: If you stand still, you'll quickly fall behind.
sentences.chinese: 如果你停滞不前，你很快就会掉队。

sentences.english: If you aren't building towards something , you're probably stagnating .
sentences.chinese: 如果没有努力的目标，你可能会停滞不前。

sentences.english: The war stagnated researches into the causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 那场战争使癌症起因的研究工作停滞不前。

sentences.english: Have you been in stagnancy before and how did you deal with it?
sentences.chinese: 你之前是否处于停滞不前，你是怎么处理的？

sentences.english: Risk can be paralyzing for most teams.
sentences.chinese: 风险会使大多数团队停滞不前。

sentences.english: No one wants this momentum to stall.
sentences.chinese: 没有人希望这一势头停滞不前。

sentences.english: Its economy is strained; witness the ever feebler dollar.
sentences.chinese: 经济停滞不前，美元的虚弱就是明证。

sentences.english: Nearly half of Gen-Xers feel stalled in their careers, the study says.
sentences.chinese: 该研究称，近半数的X世代感到在事业上停滞不前。

definition: to mark time (military)/to make no headway
to be at a standstill/to mark time
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
stagnation/at a standstill/bogged down
to do less well than before/to make a concession/setback/backward step/leeway/room to maneuver/fallback
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
bottleneck
to advance by leaps and bounds
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
thwarted/obstructed/setback
to overtake
to fall back/to go in reverse
hesitant to take action
to go downhill/to decline/to slump
to try hard to catch up
